column4: iirc checkinstall installs the deb at the end of the process
well it was not installed, i was making madwifi and it is not installed, not even a .deb here!
i dunno if checkinstall works well with kernel modules it is meant for userspace apps
so there is a chance that some kernel thing prevented it?
never tried using checkinstall with kernel modules so i dunno for sure
it uses a clippboard manager by default like (g|k)lipper. gnome does not use one neither do other Desktop Envoirments and/or window managers
so... kde already has the thing that is supposed to exist in every de!
